summary:
I am a scientist, interdisciplinary problem solver, excellent communicator and relationship builder with expertise in atomistic modeling of materials, as evidenced by several publications in peer-reviewed journals, multiple presentations at international conferences worldwide and different awards. 

With a good knowledge of chemistry and solid state physics I have also an extensive background in experimental techniques, that I have mastered during my years both in academia and industry. Due to my multidisciplinary profile I am able to interlink simulations with experimental design and execution through the effective use of resources. 

I am used to working under pressure in many different projects, environments and with many different people to which I adapt very quickly and can rapidly contribute, adding value and increasing productivity. I have worked in competitive fast-paced international companies in the pharma and semiconductor industries, and have conducted innovative quality research in computational physics, as well as in organic and computational chemistry. 

Computational skills:

Programming: Python, Fortran, bash
Simulation and modelling:
- TCAD: Synopsys Sentaurus TCAD tools, Sentaurus Materials Workbench
- DFT/Ab-initio: ADF, Gaussian, VASP, Quantum Espresso, QuantumATK, Orca, Gamess
- QM/MM 
- Classical Molecular Dynamics: Lammps, MDCASK (LLNL, USA)
- Kinetic Monte Carlo: MMonCa (IMDEA, Spain), BIGMAC (LLNL, USA), Synopsys sProcess KMC
- Genetic algorithms 
Environments: Unix/Linux, MAC OS, Windows
Other: High Performance Computing (HPC), data processing and visualisation, LaTeX, MS Office

Experimental skills: HPLC, UV, FTIR, wet chemistry, microscopy, TEM, organic synthesis, GC-MS, analytical chemistry, organic chemistry.

Transferable skills: public speaking, project management, teamwork, problem solving, analytical thinking, detail-oriented, teaching, research.

profile_positions.description:
- Multiscale modelling of materials for energy applications (Ab Initio - DFT + molecular dynamics + Monte Carlo simulations).

- Graduate teaching assistant.

volunteer_experiences.description: I participated as a volunteer assistant in this science festival organized by the University of Valencia to promote a positive image of chemistry and sciences and to demonstrate to people within the local community how chemistry is relevant and present in everyday life.
